markdownRemark.html:
After a long hiatus from PHP, I am now working on a large PHP codebase, so it’s time to get up to date with some of the more modern PHP frameworks like Lumen, Laravel, and Slim. I am going to develop some simple services using these frameworks for some hobby projects.

I want to grab

<?php
function hello() {
    return "World";
}
?>

LEMP Setup on Linode

I signed up for a cheap $5/month server on Linode, which should be sufficient for my purposes. I selected an Ubuntu 18.04 LTS image and was up and running in a few minutes. After updating packages, I ran a few commands to install nginx, PHP, and MariaDB. I’ll probably add PostgreSQL a bit later.

sudo apt install nginx
sudo apt install mariadb-server
sudo mysql_secure_installation

sudo apt-install php-mysql
sudo apt install php-fpm
CREATE DATABASE testdb;
CREATE USER 'testuser' IDENTIFIED BY 'password';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON testdb.* TO 'testuser';

sudo mkdir -p /var/www/html/example.com/public_html
